column4: i thought the whole point of having things like /usr/bin and /usr/local/bin was that i could compile from source without fear of mucking up packaged stuff.
is it inadvisible to compile things yourself in debian/ubuntu?
this is causing me a huge headache.
doesn't that defeat the whole point of /usr/bin and /usr/local/bin?
the advice is to compile up to a package..
This device is not created when the USB Harddrive is used.
i get that with my dap actually.  /dev/sda1
i'm going to reboot just for the heck of it.  i plugged the camera in before i had loaded usb_storage and sd_mod so that could have done something.  who knows..
I'm going to plug in the USB HDD, create the 'sda1' device (maj 8, min 1) and see if I can mount via that.
No luck... mount: sda1 is not a valid block device
The USB HDD looks to be a problem with the disk itself.
Soorry.. this is with the HDD, not camera.
what did the problem appear to be with the hdd.
